title: Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Ratios
content:
Module 4, Lesson 2: Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Ratios

The Hook

This lesson covers Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Ratios within the broader study of Trigonometry. Mastering these concepts will give you a solid foundation for subsequent lessons and real-world applications.

The Concept

1. Core Definitions

We begin with precise definitions that form the bedrock of Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Ratios. A rigorous understanding of terminology prevents ambiguity and enables exact communication and proof.

2. Fundamental Theorems and Results

The central theorems of Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Ratios provide powerful tools for solving problems. We state each result clearly, explain the intuition behind it, and work through representative examples.

3. Worked Examples

Each concept is illustrated with step-by-step worked examples. Pay close attention to the reasoning at each step — it is as important as the final answer.

4. Common Misconceptions

Students often confuse closely related ideas in Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Ratios. We highlight these distinctions explicitly so you can avoid common errors in exams and practical work.

The Illustration

You have completed the study of Sine, Cosine, and Tangent Ratios in Module 4 (Trigonometry). The key ideas covered in this lesson will be built upon in subsequent lessons. Attempt the quiz to consolidate your understanding before moving on.
